intake_process: Complete online screening application at https://ftp.cssalaska.org/ssvf-screening-application/ or call 907-222-7300 for referral
service_area: Anchorage Municipality and Matanuska-Susitna Borough (including Wasilla)

intake_process: Call for information; serves homeless and at-risk-of-homelessness veterans during business hours Monday-Friday 9am-5pm
service_area: Fairbanks North Star Borough (FNSB) and Interior Alaska region

intake_process: Complete Coordinated Entry Pre-Screen Form (in-person at office, by mail, or email), then eligibility review and intake appointment with case manager
service_area: Mobile and Baldwin counties, Alabama

intake_process: Call SSVF program directly at (251) 300-3968 or toll-free 800-859-4431. Services available for very low-income veterans and families facing homelessness or housing instability.
service_area: Alabama service area includes: Bibb, Blount, Cullman, Jefferson, Saint Clair, Shelby, Talladega, Tuscaloosa, and Walker counties

address: 3600 8th Avenue South (AL headquarters); 375 N. 9th Ave., Suite A (FL office)
intake_process: Call 1-866-460-3827 or submit eligibility survey at https://uweb1.unitedwayeservice.org/pvsurvey. Eligibility requirements: U.S. military veteran, separated under other than dishonorable discharge, literally homeless or at immediate risk of homelessness, household income within area limits, not enrolled with another SSVF provider.
service_area: Alabama: All 67 counties except Baldwin and Mobile counties. Florida: Escambia, Okaloosa, Santa Rosa, and Walton counties (Florida Panhandle).

intake_process: Contact office M-F 8am-4:30pm by phone or submit online request at ssvfarkansas.org. Case-by-case approval based on SSVF eligibility criteria.
service_area: All 75 counties in Arkansas (Little Rock office covers 36 counties in central/southern AR, Fayetteville covers 17 counties in northwest AR, Jonesboro covers 20 counties in northeast AR)

org_name: Volunteers of America of North Louisiana
intake_process: Call main office or email Connect@voanorthla.org. Program expansion to El Dorado, AR began November 2025.
service_area: North Louisiana (Shreveport-Bossier-Minden area, Texarkana area), Monroe LA, and El Dorado AR (as of November 2025). Estimated 300 veterans and families served.

org_name: Volunteers of America Southeast Louisiana, Inc.
intake_process: Call 504-483-3558 for intake assessment; phone screening conducted first, then scheduled for full assessment if eligible
service_area: Jefferson Parish, Orleans Parish, Plaquemines Parish, Saint Bernard Parish, Saint Charles Parish, Saint James Parish, Saint Tammany Parish, St John The Baptist Parish

intake_process: Contact main office by phone or through website; referrals accepted; case management provided for housing search and assistance
service_area: Coconino County (Flagstaff, Williams, Page, Fredonia, Forest Lake, Tusayan), Yavapai County (Prescott, Prescott Valley, Camp Verde, Chino Valley, Cottonwood, Kirkland), Mohave County (Bullhead City, Fort Mohave, Kingman, Lake Havasu City), Yavapai-Apache Indian Nation

intake_process: Call 520-308-3093 (Mon, Tue, Thu, Fri 8am-3pm MST, closed 12-1pm) for preliminary assessment. If eligible, schedule intake appointment. Bring: D214/discharge status, proof of residency, household member birth certificates, income documentation.
service_area: Pima County (primary), plus Cochise, Santa Cruz, Graham, and Greenlee counties. Rural office in Sierra Vista (1838 Paseo San Luis Sierra Vista, AZ 85635).

intake_process: Phone referral or in-person referral form. New appointments typically scheduled within 7 days. Services for eligible Arizona veterans with Arizona as home of record or deployed from Arizona.
service_area: Apache County, Cochise County, Gila County, Maricopa County, Navajo County, Pinal County, Yuma County

intake_process: Call SSVF program line or visit in person. Hours: 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. Monday-Friday
service_area: Maricopa County (Phoenix) and Yavapai County (Prescott Valley)

intake_process: Call toll-free (888) 281-6531 or complete intake form. Appointments highly recommended. Hours: 8 AM - 5 PM, Monday-Friday. Must have served at least one day active duty (not training), discharge status other than dishonorable, be homeless or at risk of homelessness, and have income at 50% or less of Area Median Income (AMI).
service_area: Maricopa, Yuma, and Pinal Counties (Arizona). Additional office in Yuma: 255 W 24th St., Ste 4. No California locations found for this grant.

intake_process: Phone intake contact: NWood@nationsfinest.org or (928) 350-8335; Call or visit location for direct services
service_area: California (26+ counties including Sacramento, Shasta, Sonoma, Santa Cruz, Monterey, Santa Clara), Nevada (Washoe County, Carson City area), Arizona (Flagstaff area - Coconino/Navajo/Gila/Apache Counties, Prescott - Yavapai County, Bullhead City - Mohave County)

org_name: Goodwill of Silicon Valley (dba Goodwill Industries of Santa Clara County)
intake_process: Call or referral; serves homeless or at-risk veterans and families
service_area: Santa Clara County

intake_process: Call or email to schedule intake appointment; Intake Coordinator conducts eligibility screening; case management and assistance with applications
service_area: Contra Costa, Marin, Solano, and Sacramento counties

org_name: Volunteers of America of Greater Sacramento and Northern Nevada, Inc.
intake_process: Call main line or submit referral through 2-1-1 (dial 8 for homelessness services). Referrals are logged and next steps sent to veteran.
service_area: Sacramento, Placer, Nevada, Yolo, Yuba, Sutter, El Dorado, and Butte Counties (Northern California & Northern Nevada)

intake_process: Contact Resource and Referral Center at (661) 829-5908. Referrals start with Case Manager. Must be veteran head of household with discharge other than dishonorable, and household must meet specific eligibility thresholds.
service_area: Kern County, California (Bakersfield area). Veterans must live in or want to live in Kern County to be eligible.

intake_process: Call 909-332-6388 or email intake@keysnonprofit.org for SSVF program intake. In-person appointments available Monday-Friday 8:00 AM - 4:30 PM PDT
service_area: San Bernardino County

intake_process: Call Outreach Team or Supportive Services for Veteran Families contact; Outreach Team: 562-676-1078; SSVF Services: 562-676-2356; National hotline: 1-877-548-7838 (877-5-4USVETS)
service_area: Los Angeles County, Orange County, Riverside County, San Bernardino County

intake_process: Call or walk-in during business hours (Mon-Thu 8AM-5PM, Fri 8AM-12PM). Contact San Joaquin Valley Veterans (SJVV) program directly.
service_area: Seven counties: Fresno, Madera, Merced, Kings, San Joaquin, Stanislaus, and Tulare

org_name: Swords To Plowshares Veterans Rights Organization
intake_process: Walk-in, call, or request outreach meeting. Needs assessment and case management conducted to determine eligibility and connect with appropriate housing solutions.
service_area: Alameda County, Marin County, San Francisco County, San Mateo County

intake_process: Contact by phone (951) 571-3533 or email info@lighthouse-ssc.org during business hours (Monday-Friday, 8:30 AM - 5:00 PM). Walk-in available.
service_area: San Bernardino and Riverside counties

intake_process: Call intake line at 310-348-8250 for rental assistance services, or call National Hotline 1-877-424-3838 to schedule appointment
service_area: Los Angeles County, Orange County, Riverside County, San Bernardino County

org_name: Community Action Partnership of San Luis Obispo County, Inc.
intake_process: Contact the SSVF provider directly or call the National Call Center for Homeless Veterans at 1-877-4AID-VET (1-877-424-3838)
service_area: San Luis Obispo County, CA (also serves Fresno, Kern, Monterey, and other California counties)

org_name: Mental Health America of Los Angeles
intake_process: Contact main office or call SSVF/HOMECOMING program coordinator at (562) 760-3875 for referrals. Veterans can also call (888) 242-2522 for intake services. Initial phone screening followed by in-person intake assessment. Veterans must provide proof of veteran status and income documentation. HOMECOMING program (OHH/SSVF) provides supportive services for veterans and families experiencing homelessness or at risk, including assistance with housing, benefits, temporary financial assistance, accessing VA services, healthcare, employment, and links to long-term supports.
service_area: Los Angeles City & County CoC (CA-600) and Long Beach CoC (CA-606). Additional service area includes Antelope Valley communities (Lancaster, Palmdale area). Primary locations in Long Beach and Lancaster.

org_name: Homefirst Services Of Santa Clara County
intake_process: Contact SSVF program coordinator (email: cunciano@homefirstscc.org or phone: 408-539-2183) or call main helpline at 408-510-7600. HomeFirst provides rapid re-housing and homeless prevention assistance to eligible Veterans and their families who are homeless or at risk of becoming homeless.
service_area: Santa Clara County, California

intake_process: Contact PATH through Coordinated Entry System or call PATH Service/Intake at (323) 644-2216. Veterans must meet SSVF eligibility: veteran status, homelessness or at-risk of homelessness, and household income below 80% of Area Median Income (AMI). Provides case management, housing assistance, financial counseling, benefits navigation, employment/job training support, childcare assistance, and legal services.
service_area: Los Angeles County, San Diego County, San Luis Obispo County, Santa Barbara County, and Ventura County, California. Serves Los Angeles City & County CoC (CA-600) and San Diego City and County CoC (CA-601) areas under VISN 22: Desert Pacific Healthcare Network.

intake_process: Contact SSVF program at 619-339-0111 or email ssvf@vvsd.net for intake and eligibility assessment
service_area: San Diego County

intake_process: Call 323-482-3305 for housing stability counseling, advocacy regarding housing issues, temporary financial assistance, and housing counseling. Veterans must not be dishonorably discharged, have household income not exceeding 50% AMI, and be currently homeless or at imminent risk of homelessness.
service_area: Los Angeles County, Orange County, and Santa Barbara County in California

intake_process: Contact during business hours Monday-Friday 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM PDT. SSVF program provides temporary assistance and services to help homeless veterans and their families gain housing stability. Services available for veterans currently homeless or at risk of losing housing.
service_area: San Luis Obispo County, California

intake_process: Contact PATH San Diego SSVF at (619) 860-7108 or email joses@epath.org. Hours: Monday-Friday 8:00am-4:00pm. Program provides case management, temporary financial assistance, and supportive services to help homeless veterans and families obtain permanent housing.
service_area: Greater San Diego region and surrounding areas in California

intake_process: Call 24-hour hotline (213) 745-6434 or (213) 222-1237. Veteran Families Program serves veterans experiencing homelessness or in imminent danger of becoming homeless. Services include homelessness prevention, rapid re-housing, case management, legal aid, connections to VA benefits, and employment/educational linkages.
service_area: Los Angeles County and Orange County, California

intake_process: Contact intake at (858) 300-9974 or email yasmin.gandara@adjoin.org. Adjoin uses a housing-first strategy to secure permanent housing for veteran families. Services include intake, assessment, case management, housing assistance, daily living skills training, job development, substance abuse prevention, and follow-up services for eligible low-income veterans.
service_area: San Diego and Imperial County (grant covers 20 California counties: Alpine, Amador, Calaveras, Fresno, Imperial, Kings, Lake, Madera, Mariposa, Mendocino, Merced, Monterey, San Benito, San Diego, San Joaquin, Santa Clara, Santa Cruz, Stanislaus, Tulare, Tuolumne)

intake_process: Contact the SSVF provider directly or call the National Call Center for Homeless Veterans at 1-877-4AID-VET (1-877-424-3838)
service_area: Santa Barbara County, CA

org_name: Volunteers of America of Los Angeles
intake_process: Contact ssvfla@voala.org or call SSVF intake at (323) 657-5550
service_area: Los Angeles County, CA

intake_process: Contact vets@bfhp.org or call (888) 479-1926
service_area: Alameda, Amador, Contra Costa, Sacramento, San Francisco, San Joaquin, and Solano counties, CA

intake_process: Contact ssvf@villageforvets.org or call (323) 609-9206
service_area: Los Angeles, CA

intake_process: Contact sconliffe@jvs-socal.org or call (213) 742-9544
service_area: Los Angeles, CA

intake_process: Contact ssvf@villageforvets.org or call (323) 609-9206
service_area: Los Angeles, CA

intake_process: For SSVF Homes for All Veterans (HAV) program, call 855-838-7428 or contact 303-636-5600
service_area: Colorado (Denver, Colorado Springs, multi-county)

intake_process: Contact info@voacolorado.org or call regional offices for SSVF support
service_area: Colorado and New Mexico

intake_process: Contact (860) 560-5600 for SSVF program intake
service_area: Connecticut

intake_process: Contact (203) 610-8500 for SSVF program
service_area: Connecticut

intake_process: Contact county-specific extension: Middlesex County ext 648/442/601, New Haven County ext 612/601, New London County ext 848/620/601 at (203) 401-4400
service_area: Middlesex, New Haven, and New London counties, Connecticut

intake_process: Contact regional offices: Vermont (378 North Main St, Bradford, VT 05033) or Maine (393 Main St, Lewiston, ME 04240)
service_area: Connecticut, Massachusetts, Maine, New Hampshire, Rhode Island, Vermont

intake_process: Contact ssvfprogram@housingetc.org or call 202-667-7366
service_area: DC, Prince George's County MD, Montgomery County MD, Fairfax County VA, Alexandria VA, Arlington County VA

intake_process: Contact through website or mailing address: PO Box 10142 Alexandria, VA 22310
service_area: DC Metro region, Maryland, Virginia

intake_process: Contact Veterans First screening line at 202.658.9599 or general line at 202.364.1419
service_area: Washington DC and eight surrounding counties in Maryland and Virginia

intake_process: Call toll-free intake line at 1-866-406-8449 or email ssvfintake@wesoldieron.org. Brief phone screening followed by in-person needs assessment. Veterans must provide proof of veteran status and documentation. Mobile outreach available.
service_area: Delaware, Massachusetts, New Jersey, New York, Pennsylvania

intake_process: Contact main office Monday-Friday 8:30am-4:30pm. Eligibility screening conducted by team member during intake. Documentation required but no costs to access programs. Organization can assist in obtaining necessary documents.
service_area: Pennsylvania (Bucks, Chester, Montgomery, Delaware Counties), Delaware, Southern New Jersey

intake_process: Call 786-227-6842 or toll-free 1-855-358-SSVF. Services include case management, employment services, health navigation, housing navigation, legal assistance, and temporary financial assistance.
service_area: Miami-Dade County and Monroe County, Florida

org_name: Jewish Family & Childrens Service Of The Suncoast Inc
intake_process: Contact main office at 941-366-2224 or email info@jfcs-cares.org. Serves veterans in Sarasota, Manatee, Charlotte, Collier, DeSoto and Lee counties with SSVF Grant Number 77077.
service_area: Sarasota, Manatee, Charlotte, Collier, DeSoto, and Lee counties, Florida

intake_process: Contact Stand Down House initiative at 561-968-1612 or veteran services line at 561-560-8110. Founded 1994 by veterans. Serves Palm Beach County with mission to end veteran homelessness.
service_area: Palm Beach County, Florida

intake_process: Call 850-576-5566 or 850-597-5595 or email veteran@familypromisebigbend.org. SSVF program provides case management, homelessness prevention and rapid rehousing for qualified low income veterans.
service_area: Tallahassee and 7 surrounding counties in Big Bend region, Florida

org_name: United Way of Broward County, Inc.
intake_process: Contact Mission United program at 954-462-4850. Available since 2013, program serves veterans and families experiencing or at risk of homelessness with case management and financial assistance.
service_area: Broward County, Florida

org_name: Treasure Coast Homeless Services Council, Inc.
intake_process: Contact main office at 772-213-9040 or visit office Monday-Friday 8:30am-4:30pm. SSVF program provides outreach, case management, VA benefits assistance, and temporary financial assistance.
service_area: Indian River County and Saint Lucie County, Florida

org_name: Homeless Services Network of Central Florida, Inc.
intake_process: Contact through 2-1-1 hotline or email veteran@hsncfl.org. HSN is lead agency for VA SSVF grant program for Central Florida continuum of care (Orange, Osceola, Seminole counties).
service_area: Orange, Osceola, and Seminole counties including Orlando, Kissimmee, and Sanford, Florida

org_name: Volunteers of America of Florida, Inc.
address: 96 Willard Street, Unit 206 (Cocoa office) or 4630 Lipscomb Street NE, Suite 1 (Palm Bay office)
intake_process: Contact Brevard County SSVF at 352-240-3787 or email CocoaSSVFInfo@voa-fla.org. Program assists veterans experiencing housing instability with case management, housing navigation, and temporary financial aid.
service_area: Brevard County (Palm Bay, Cocoa areas) and multiple Florida locations statewide

org_name: Society of St. Vincent de Paul South Pinellas, Inc.
intake_process: Contact by phone at (727) 209-1200 or visit office. SSVF program provides emergency financial assistance and case management for low-income veteran families. Initial intake includes eligibility screening (veteran status verification via DD-214, income at/below 50% AMI) and needs assessment.
service_area: Pinellas County, FL including St. Petersburg, Clearwater, Largo, and surrounding communities

intake_process: Call (386) 258-6455 or visit website for SSVF program intake. Serves homeless and at-risk veteran families across FL and GA. Rapid rehousing and prevention services with case management and financial assistance. Mobile outreach available.
service_area: Central Florida (Volusia, Flagler, Seminole counties) and Southern Georgia communities

org_name: Central Savannah River Area Economic Opportunity Authority, Inc. (CSRA EOA)
intake_process: Contact CSRA EOA main line at (706) 821-2500 or visit office for SSVF intake. Veterans seeking emergency rental assistance, utilities, or case management can apply. Eligibility based on veteran status, homelessness/at-risk status, and income requirements.
service_area: Central Savannah River Area (14 counties): Aiken SC, Allendale SC, Barnwell SC, Burke GA, Columbia GA, Edgefield SC, Glascock GA, Hancock GA, Jefferson GA, Lincoln GA, McDuffie SC, Richmond GA, Saluda SC, Warren GA

intake_process: Call main line (404) 973-8830 or visit Atlanta office for SSVF intake. Veterans experiencing homelessness or housing instability can apply for rapid rehousing and homelessness prevention. Case managers assist with housing search, deposits, utilities assistance.
service_area: Metropolitan Atlanta and surrounding Georgia counties including Fulton, Dekalb, Clayton, Henry, Gwinnett, Cobb, and Marietta

org_name: Travelers Aid of Metro Atlanta, Inc.
intake_process: Call (404) 688-9436 during business hours (M-F 9am-5pm) or visit office at Peachtree Street location. SSVF program assists veteran families at-risk of homelessness with emergency funds, housing deposits, utility assistance, and case management. Initial phone screening determines eligibility.
service_area: Metropolitan Atlanta area (Fulton, Dekalb, Clayton, Henry, Cobb, Gwinnett counties) and surrounding North Georgia communities

intake_process: Contact PCC at (770) 990-3840 or visit Marietta office. SSVF program provides rapid rehousing, homelessness prevention, case management, and financial assistance. Veterans apply through intake appointment; eligibility includes veteran status verification, income assessment, housing crisis documentation.
service_area: North Atlanta suburbs and surrounding counties including Cobb, Cherokee, Forsyth, and parts of Fulton and Dekalb

intake_process: Call (404) 973-8830 or visit Atlanta office. Same provider as 15-GA-325. SSVF services for veteran families including rapid rehousing, housing prevention, case management, and emergency financial assistance. Veterans must provide DD-214 and income documentation.
service_area: Georgia statewide with primary focus on Atlanta metro area and surrounding counties

intake_process: Call (615) 320-7500 or visit Nashville office for SSVF program intake. Serves veteran families in TN and GA. Program provides case management, emergency financial assistance, housing support, and connections to behavioral health services. Eligibility screening based on veteran status and income.
service_area: Tennessee statewide focus with expansion to Georgia counties. Primary service area includes Nashville, Memphis, Knoxville metro areas and surrounding counties

intake_process: Contact WestCare Guam at (671) 646-9370 or visit main office in Hagatna. SSVF program serves veteran families on Guam and Pacific territories. Services include emergency rental assistance, utilities support, case management, and rapid rehousing. Intake includes veteran status verification and income assessment.
service_area: Guam and other US Pacific territories under VISN 21: Sierra Pacific Network jurisdiction

intake_process: Call Hawaii office at (808) 524-8474 or visit Honolulu location. USVI operates SSVF program serving homeless and at-risk veteran families across Hawaiian islands. Phone intake screening followed by in-person needs assessment. Services: rapid rehousing, prevention, financial assistance, case management.
service_area: All Hawaiian islands including Oahu, Hawaii, Maui, Kauai counties with primary office in Honolulu

intake_process: Phone intake at 808-527-4986
service_area: Hawaii

intake_process: Phone intake at 808-527-4986
service_area: Hawaii

intake_process: Phone intakes Mon-Fri 8am-9am at 515-248-1851
service_area: Des Moines metro area

org_name: Family Alliance For Veterans of America, Inc.
intake_process: Phone intake at 641-243-4103
service_area: 43 counties in Northern Iowa

org_name: Hawkeye Area Community Action Program, Inc.
intake_process: Contact main office for SSVF intake
service_area: Eastern Iowa counties

intake_process: Phone interview at 563-217-1657, followed by intake coordinator interview
service_area: 9 counties in Iowa and Illinois (Scott, Clinton, Jackson, Muscatine, Henry, Lee, Mercer, Rock Island, Whiteside)

intake_process: Contact Administrative Office or call main number
service_area: Iowa, Illinois, Kentucky

intake_process: Contact SSVF program directly at 402-729-2278 x147
service_area: Butler, Fillmore, Gage, Jefferson, Polk, Saline, Seward, Thayer, York counties in Nebraska, plus Iowa service area

intake_process: Contact by phone (402) 379-8224 or visit website for application details. Low-income Ponca members and qualified Native Americans eligible.
service_area: 15 counties across Nebraska, Iowa, and South Dakota. Cities served: Council Bluffs IA, Sioux City IA, Wagner SD, Battle Creek NE, Bellevue NE, Columbus NE, Lincoln NE, Niobrara NE, Norfolk NE, Omaha NE

intake_process: Apply in person at the Boise office or call for information
service_area: Ada County, Elmore County, and Owyhee County

intake_process: Phone screening (509-529-4980 ext. 614), enrollment within one business day if eligible. Online application available for homeless prevention assistance. For Walla Walla County: contact Coordinated Entry first.
service_area: Washington: Asotin, Columbia, Garfield, Klickitat, Skamania, Walla Walla, Whitman, Benton, Franklin, Yakima counties; Oregon: Morrow, Umatilla, Union, Wallowa counties; Idaho: Nez Perce County (Lewiston area)

intake_process: Call (801) 689-1516 or email ssvf@homelessveterans.org to speak with a case manager and schedule an appointment. Online intake form also available on website. Hours: Monday-Friday 8:30am-4:30pm
service_area: Southeastern Idaho and State of Utah (excluding Salt Lake County). Specific counties include: Bannock, Bear Lake, Caribou, Franklin, Oneida, Power in Idaho; and all Utah counties except Salt Lake

org_name: Goodwill Industries Of The Inland Northwest
intake_process: Call 509-828-2449 to schedule an appointment. Program is free and eligibility-based.
service_area: Ferry County WA, Pend Oreille County WA, Spokane County WA, Stevens County WA; also serves Kootenai County ID, Chelan County WA, Douglas County WA

intake_process: Call Veterans Project intake line at (773) 572-5321 or contact Fernando Valles, Director, at (773) 537-3154. Veterans experiencing homelessness, mental health issues, trauma, substance use, or unemployment can call to inquire about eligibility and begin intake.
service_area: Metropolitan Chicago and surrounding counties including Cook, DeKalb, DuPage, Grundy, Jasper, Kane, Kendall, Kenosha, Lake, McHenry, Newton, Porter, and Will counties

intake_process: Call SSVF hotline at 773-336-6088 (Monday-Friday, 8:30am-5:00pm) or call 311 and ask for 'short term help'. Veterans must provide DD-214 or proof of veteran status. Program assists with emergency rental assistance for those at-risk of homelessness or currently homeless.
service_area: City of Chicago and suburban Cook County

intake_process: Call 773-721-7088 or visit featherfist.org/need-help-now/ for immediate assistance. Veterans can also call the National Call Center for Homeless Veterans at 1-877-4AID-VET for referral.
service_area: Cook County, IL (Chicago CoC IL-510 and Cook County CoC IL-511)

org_name: Midwest Shelter for Homeless Veterans, Inc.
intake_process: Contact SSVF intake team at 630-871-8387 x610 or email intake@mshv.org. Organization provides intensive case management, housing stabilization services, and temporary financial assistance to eligible veterans and families facing homelessness.
service_area: 10 northern Illinois counties: Bureau, DeKalb, DuPage, Grundy, Kane, Kankakee, Kendall, LaSalle, Putnam, and Will

intake_process: Call SSVF program directly at 618-512-1823 or main office at 888-924-3786. Eligibility verification required (veteran status, income verification at 50% area median income threshold). Case management and intake assessment conducted at facility.
service_area: Madison and St. Clair Counties, Illinois (Belleville, Granite City, Edwardsville, and surrounding areas)

intake_process: Referrals from local VA Medical Centers, other service providers, street outreach, and word of mouth. Contact (312) 564-2300 for intake and application details.
service_area: Chicago, Cook County (IL-511), Will County/Joliet/Bolingbrook (IL-506), and Indiana Balance of State (IN-502). Serves veterans across all eras from WWII to current Middle East conflicts.

intake_process: Call case managers directly or contact main office. Case managers: Sean Merchant (815-529-4080) or Ryan Jacobsen (224-634-0029). Veterans can also reach out for possible assistance through the main phone line.
service_area: Kenosha County, WI and Lake, McHenry, Boone, and Winnebago counties in northern Illinois

org_name: Community Action of Northeast Indiana, Inc.
intake_process: Call (260) 423-3546 ext. 332 or submit contact form through website. Must meet income guidelines and be a veteran who is homeless or at risk of homelessness.
service_area: Adams, Allen, Blackford, Cass, DeKalb, Delaware, Elkhart, Fulton, Grant, Henry, Howard, Huntington, Jay, Kosciusko, LaGrange, Marshall, Miami, Noble, Pulaski, Randolph, Steuben, St. Joseph, Tipton, Wabash, Wells, and Whitley counties in Northeast Indiana

intake_process: Contact via phone or email (lthc@lthc.net) for intake assessment. LTHC is the Coordinated Point of Entry for housing crisis services. They conduct intake, assessment, and triage to identify the best housing solution.
service_area: Benton, Carroll, Clinton, Fountain, Montgomery, Tippecanoe, Warren, and White counties (primary coverage with Lafayette and Crawfordsville as major service hubs)

intake_process: Call 855-896-4345 to schedule an eligibility screening appointment or visit intake form online
service_area: Boone, Clay, Hamilton, Hancock, Johnson, Madison, Marion, Parke, Putnam, Shelby, Sullivan, Vermillion, and Vigo counties in Indiana

org_name: Volunteers of America of Indiana, Inc.
intake_process: Contact program by email at veteransinfo@voaohin.org with your full name, city, state, organization (if applicable), and phone number. Veterans must be honorably discharged with income below 50% of area median income and either in permanent housing or scheduled to move within 90 days.
service_area: Central Indiana (Marion County and surrounding region via Indianapolis office); Southwest Indiana including Vanderburgh, Warrick, Pike, and Gibson Counties (via Evansville office)

intake_process: Call 317-951-0688 to schedule an intake appointment. Veterans and veteran families with any military discharge (other than dishonorable) who are homeless or at risk of homelessness can apply.
service_area: Marion County, Indiana

intake_process: Referrals coordinated through Central Access Point (CAP). Call 513-381-7233 to arrange intake. Program serves single veterans and families with veteran head of household who are low-income, homeless or at risk of homelessness, with Other than Dishonorable Discharge status.
service_area: Hamilton County (OH) and 9 surrounding counties: Butler (OH), Clermont (OH), Warren (OH), Switzerland (IN), Ohio (IN), Kenton (KY), Campbell (KY), Boone (KY). Service area encompasses Greater Cincinnati region.

intake_process: Contact regional office by phone. Intake coordinator completes screening assessment, verifies eligibility (veteran family status, income <= 50% AMI, housing status), and assigns to case manager. Applicants enrolled in HMIS (Homeless Management Information System).
service_area: Kentucky (multiple counties), Tennessee (Knox, Washington, Sullivan counties), West Virginia (Raleigh, Wyoming, Logan counties), and Clark and Floyd counties in Indiana.

org_name: St. Vincent de Paul Social Services, Inc.
intake_process: Call SSVF Intake Hotline at 1-888-751-1238 to apply. Must meet eligibility: (1) Member of veteran family with veteran as head of household or spouse, (2) Very low income (not exceeding 80% of area median income), (3) Homeless or at imminent risk of homelessness.
service_area: 12 Ohio counties (Allen, Auglaize, Champaign, Clark, Clinton, Darke, Greene, Mercer, Miami, Montgomery, Preble, Shelby) and 4 Indiana counties (Wayne, Fayette, Franklin, Union)

intake_process: Contact by phone or visit office Monday-Friday 8 AM-5 PM by appointment. Services include homeless prevention, rental assistance, and case management for veterans and families at risk of homelessness.
service_area: 25-county region in south-central and southeastern Kansas including Coffey, Lyon, Osage, Shawnee, and Wabunsee counties

intake_process: Call 1-844-596-7783 or 816-670-2414 for initial contact and prescreening
service_area: Kansas and Northwest Missouri (Andrew, Atchison, Buchanan, Cass, Clay, Holt, Jackson, Nodaway, Platte, Ray counties)

org_name: Catholic Charities of Kansas City - St Joseph, Inc.
intake_process: Call (816) 659-8263 for screening and assistance. If you leave a message, allow 24 business hours for callback. Walk-ins welcomed at Welcome Center for holistic intake and assessment.
service_area: Kansas City, MO and St. Joseph, MO areas (serves KS and MO)

org_name: Kentucky River Foothills Development Council, Inc.
intake_process: Contact by phone at (859) 408-7017 to verify eligibility and gather required documents (DD-214, HINQ report, or VHA card with discharge status other than Dishonorable, HUD income verification, and proof of housing crisis such as eviction notice or shelter statement).
service_area: 21 Kentucky counties: Bath, Breathitt, Clark, Clay, Estill, Jackson, Laurel, Lee, Madison, Menifee, Montgomery, Morgan, Owsley, Perry, Powell, Pulaski, Rockcastle, Rowan, Russell, Wayne, and Wolfe

intake_process: Contact by phone (504-363-4034) or visit in person. Eligibility requirements: minimum one day active duty service (non-dishonable discharge), currently experiencing homelessness or housing instability, and at or below 50% Area Median Income (AMI).
service_area: Jefferson Parish, LA (including Gretna, Metairie, and New Orleans areas)

intake_process: Call Start Corporation's Thibodaux office at 985-446-5244 during business hours (Monday-Friday, 8:00 AM - 4:30 PM CST) to inquire about SSVF eligibility and begin the intake process.
service_area: Orleans Parish and surrounding areas in Louisiana; Start Corporation operates additional offices in Shreveport and Mandeville covering VISN 16 South Central VA Health Care Network.

org_name: Volunteers of America of Massachusetts, Inc.
intake_process: Contact main office at 617-522-8086 or SSVF program line at 617-770-9690. Veterans and veteran families at risk of homelessness or losing current residence can inquire about eligibility for SSVF supportive services.
service_area: Massachusetts (statewide through VISN 1: VA New England Healthcare System coverage)

intake_process: Veterans and families experiencing homelessness or at risk of losing their home can apply for SSVF housing stability services by calling (617) 371-1800.
service_area: 11 Massachusetts Continuums of Care including Boston, Lynn, New Bedford, Lowell, Cambridge, Essex County, Quincy/Brockton/Weymouth/Plymouth, Fall River, Massachusetts Balance of State, Somerville, and Attleboro/Taunton/Bristol County

org_name: Cape and Islands Veterans Outreach Center
intake_process: Veterans can call (508) 778-1590 or email info@capeveterans.com to inquire about SSVF and other services. Rent payments, security deposits, moving costs, emergency housing, utility arrears covered.
service_area: Cape and Islands region of Massachusetts (Barnstable County including Hyannis, Nantucket, and surrounding areas)

org_name: Clear Path for Veterans New England Inc.
intake_process: Contact via phone (978-384-8800 or SSVF hotline 978-362-9757), email (ssvf@clearpathne.org), or in-person. Case managers facilitate assistance with housing crises, employment services, and financial assistance.
service_area: New England (Massachusetts and New Hampshire) with locations in Devens MA, Methuen MA, and Manchester NH

intake_process: Contact organization directly by phone or email (gethelp@threeoakscenter.org) for intake information and services eligibility
service_area: St. Mary's County, Maryland

intake_process: Call 410-837-1400 ext. 148 for veteran intake. Accessibility accommodations available at primary location.
service_area: Baltimore City and Baltimore County, Maryland

org_name: New Vision House of Hope Inc
intake_process: Call 410-466-8558 for details or complete online contact form. Monday-Friday 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM.

intake_process: Call 410-213-0923 to inquire about SSVF program eligibility and begin the intake process.
service_area: Somerset County, Wicomico County, and Worcester County, Maryland (Lower Eastern Shore region)

org_name: St James AME Zion Church-Zion House
intake_process: Contact organization directly via phone or email (zionhouse@netscape.com). Office hours: Monday-Friday 8AM-5PM
service_area: 9+ counties across Maryland, Delaware, and Virginia (Caroline, Dorchester, Kent, Queen Anne, Somerset, Talbot, Wicomico, Worcester MD; Sussex DE; Accomack VA)

intake_process: Contact by phone at (410) 662-0500 or email info@vincentbaltimore.org.

service_area: St. Louis City, St. Louis County, and seven surrounding counties

intake_process: Contact via phone (646-619-3277) or email for intake assessment. Veterans must provide DD-214 and income verification.

intake_process: Contact by phone at (914) 595-0968 for Westchester/Rockland/Putnam region or (845) 926-9914 for Dutchess/Ulster/Orange/Sullivan region
service_area: Six-county region: Westchester, Rockland, Putnam, Dutchess, Orange, and Ulster counties

intake_process: Apply online, call (315) 424-1800 (Mon-Fri 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM), or visit Cathedral Emergency Services building at 262 E Onondaga Street
service_area: Onondaga County and surrounding Central New York region

intake_process: Call toll-free intake line at 1-866-406-8449 or email ssvfintake@wesoldieron.org for brief intake interview, followed by in-person needs assessment. Mobile outreach service model - no walk-in office for NY.
service_area: 18 counties in Central Upstate New York: St. Lawrence, Jefferson, Lewis, Oswego, Oneida, Madison, Onondaga, Cayuga, Seneca, Schuyler, Tompkins, Cortland, Chenango, Broome, Tioga, Chemung, and Steuben. Principal cities: Binghamton, Syracuse, Rochester, and Utica.

intake_process: Call 315-765-0975 during business hours (Monday-Friday: 8 AM-3:30 PM) or use emergency line 315-601-4662. SSVF services available for low-income veteran families homeless or at-risk of homelessness. Eligibility requires at least one veteran and income below 80% of Area Median Income.
service_area: Oneida, Herkimer, Madison, Jefferson, Lewis, and St. Lawrence counties in New York

intake_process: Contact directly via phone or email (Info@vchcny.org) to inquire about SSVF program eligibility and application. Veterans can also be referred through local VA Medical Centers.
service_area: Saratoga, Schenectady, Warren, Washington, Fulton, Montgomery, and Schoharie counties

org_name: Economic Opportunity Council Of Suffolk Inc
intake_process: Call 631-289-2601 Ext. 128 (Yanory Chicas) for application and intake information
service_area: Suffolk County, NY

intake_process: Contact the organization by phone or email. Primary intake location is Sgt. Henry Johnson Veterans House (32 beds). Veterans can call to inquire about SSVF rapid rehousing and homelessness prevention services.
service_area: Albany, Rensselaer, Columbia, Greene, Ulster, Sullivan, and Schoharie counties in New York. Main office in Albany with additional programs in Schenectady.

org_name: Volunteers of America-Greater New York, Inc.
intake_process: Call 718-993-3564, visit office in person, or email voa4vets@voa-gny.org. Serves veterans experiencing or at risk of homelessness.
service_area: All five boroughs of New York City (Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens, Bronx, Staten Island)

intake_process: Call 646-790-2449 (Option 1 for intake/outreach); veterans can also visit the office Monday-Friday 9am-5pm or by appointment. Veterans apply through the non-profit organization with eligibility assessment based on veteran status (DD214, not dishorable discharge), homelessness/eviction threat, and income at or below 50% AMI.
service_area: New York City (Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens, Bronx); also serves Long Island (Nassau and Suffolk Counties) via Long Island office at 600 Albany Avenue, Suite 1, Amityville, NY 11701, phone 631-227-0777

intake_process: Phone call to 646-970-7170 or email ssvf@jerichoproject.org to inquire about eligibility. Veterans must complete an eligibility assessment form detailing current housing situation, employment status, military service history, and contact information.
service_area: New York City (Manhattan, Bronx, Queens). Primary focus in Bronx County and New York County with citywide supportive apartment placement program.

org_name: Veterans One-stop Center of WNY, Inc.
intake_process: Call or walk-in during business hours (Monday-Friday, 8:30am-5pm)
service_area: Erie, Niagara, Genesee, Wyoming, Allegany, Cattaraugus, Chautauqua, and Orleans counties

org_name: University of Vermont and State Agricultural College
intake_process: Call intake line at (802) 656-3232 or toll-free (844) 820-3232 during business hours (Monday-Friday, 8:30 AM-4:30 PM). For emergencies outside business hours, call 2-1-1. Services available for very-low income veteran families (below 80% Area Median Income) who are homeless or at risk within 30 days.
service_area: All 13 Vermont counties and Clinton County, New York

org_name: Mental Health Services for Homeless Persons, Inc. d.b.a FrontLine Service
intake_process: Phone intake only (Monday-Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.). Call 216-674-6700 for Cuyahoga County or 440-381-8347 for Lake and Ashtabula counties to request information and begin services. Walk-in appointments unavailable.
service_area: Cuyahoga County (Cleveland), Lake County, and Ashtabula County in Northeast Ohio

intake_process: Call SSVF Program Manager Jenny Hoeffel at 800-569-3980 ext. 2107 to inquire about program information, eligibility requirements, or schedule an appointment
service_area: Defiance, Fulton, Henry, Paulding, and Williams Counties, Ohio

intake_process: Call to schedule appointment; contact info@lcchousing.org or 740-345-1970
service_area: Licking, Knox, and Coshocton Counties, Ohio

org_name: Family & Community Services, Inc. / Axess Family Services, Inc.
intake_process: Call 24/7 hotline (1-855-234-7310) for intake and eligibility assessment. Veteran advocates meet you where you are. Can also reach main office at 330-296-2100.
service_area: Mahoning County (Youngstown), Summit County (Akron, Barberton), Stark County (Canton, Massillon, Alliance), Portage County, Trumbull County, Lorain County, Geauga County, Medina County, Ashtabula County

org_name: Community Action Agency of Columbiana County, Inc.
intake_process: Call to schedule appointment for SSVF program intake
service_area: Columbiana, Carroll, Harrison, Jefferson, Mahoning, and Tuscarawas Counties

org_name: Community Action Program Corporation of Washington-Morgan Counties, Ohio
intake_process: Call 740-373-3745 ext. 306 to speak with Emily Maze (Lead Veteran Case Manager) for case management and financial assistance
service_area: 11 southeast Ohio counties: Washington, Morgan, Muskingum, Gallia, Meigs, Athens, Noble, Guernsey, Monroe, Vinton, and Belmont

intake_process: Call 614-224-6617 to speak with Twanna Roper (veterans services coordinator). Telephone intake available.
service_area: Franklin County, Ohio (Columbus area)

intake_process: Call 2-1-1 or 330-762-4663 for intake and screening. Walk-in availability at 111 E. Voris St. Monday-Friday 8:30am-4:30pm
service_area: Summit County and Northern Summit County, Ohio

intake_process: Contact the Marion location directly at (740) 382-2156. Referrals also accepted through 211 helpline or community partners including Marion Shelter Program (740-382-9600) and Family Promise of Delaware County (740-362-7817). Program targets individual veterans or families with a veteran head of household experiencing housing crisis.
service_area: Ashland County, Crawford County, Delaware County, Hardin County, Logan County, Madison County, Marion County, Morrow County, Richland County, Union County, and Wayne County (Ohio Balance of State)

org_name: Lutheran Social Services Of Central Ohio Inc
intake_process: Call Twanna Roper at intake number (614-224-6617) for SSVF services
service_area: Central Ohio - Ohio Balance of State Continuum of Care (21+ Ohio counties served by organization)

intake_process: Call or email veteransinfo@voaohin.org. Veterans must meet eligibility requirements: honorable discharge, income below 50% of area median, and must be in or moving to permanent housing within 90 days.
service_area: Ohio: Cuyahoga County (Cleveland), Delaware County, Fairfield County, Franklin County (Columbus), Montgomery County (Dayton). Indiana: Marion County (Indianapolis), Vanderburgh County (Evansville).

org_name: KI BOIS Community Action Foundation, Inc.
intake_process: Contact office during business hours (Monday-Friday 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM CST) by phone or visit office. Housing First model rapid re-housing program.
service_area: Adair, Atoka, Bryan, Carter, Cherokee, Choctaw, Coal, Haskell, Hughes, Johnston, Latimer, Le Flore, Love, Marshall, Mccurtain, Mcintosh, Murray, Muskogee, Okfuskee, Okmulgee, Pittsburg, Pontotoc, Pushmataha, and Sequoyah counties in southeastern Oklahoma

org_name: Community Service Council of Greater Tulsa, Inc. (now Oklahoma Veterans United)
intake_process: Call SSVF intake line (918-834-2665, 405-724-3360, or 580-557-0755) for application assistance
service_area: 56 counties across Oklahoma including Tulsa, Oklahoma County, and regional areas from panhandle to southeast Oklahoma

intake_process: Contact Veterans Office directly; application process not specified online
service_area: Kiowa County and Comanche County (KCA and WDC areas), plus southwestern Oklahoma

intake_process: Call or visit main office; referral-based through VA, VSO, or self-referral. Case management provided.
service_area: Columbia, Clatsop, and Tillamook Counties

org_name: Central Oregon Veteran & Community Outreach, Inc
intake_process: Call (541) 383-2793 or visit Outreach Center Monday-Friday 9am-4pm. Walk-in services available.
service_area: Crook County, Deschutes County, and Jefferson County, Oregon

org_name: St. Vincent de Paul Society of Lane County, Inc.
intake_process: Call the Outreach Specialist at 541-743-7170. Office hours: 8:30 AM - 5:00 PM Monday-Friday
service_area: Lane County, Oregon (includes Eugene, Springfield, and surrounding cities)

intake_process: Call Veteran Intake Coordinator at 458-488-1340 (Mon-Fri, 8:30am-4:30pm) or call 24/7 veteran line at 541-774-4322. Can also complete contact form on website.
service_area: Coos, Curry, Douglas, Jackson, and Josephine counties in Southern Oregon

intake_process: Phone intake at (971) 317-9660. Required documentation: photo ID, DD Form 214, proof of household income, lease/eviction notices, social security cards for all household members
service_area: Multnomah, Marion, and Polk Counties (Portland and Salem locations)

intake_process: Contact Community Action office directly. Veterans must have household income not exceeding 50% of area median income. Services include temporary financial assistance, case management, and housing placement assistance.
service_area: 13 counties in Oregon including Washington County, Multnomah County, and surrounding areas via six Community Action Agency sub-grantees

intake_process: Call 855-425-5544 or complete Veterans Services pre-screening form at https://www.tprojects.org/veterans-services-pre-screening-form
service_area: Clackamas County OR, Clark County WA, Columbia County OR, Multnomah County OR, Skamania County WA, Washington County OR, Yamhill County OR

org_name: Veterans Leadership Program of Western Pennsylvania, Inc.
intake_process: Call 844-VLP-VETS (844-835-8387) or complete online form. Veterans must be at imminent risk of or currently experiencing homelessness with household income under 50% Area Median Income.
service_area: 30 counties: Allegheny, Armstrong, Beaver, Bedford, Blair, Butler, Cambria, Centre, Clarion, Clearfield, Crawford, Elk, Erie, Fayette, Forest, Fulton, Greene, Huntingdon, Indiana, Jefferson, Lawrence, McKean, Mercer, Somerset, Venango, Warren, Washington, Westmoreland (PA), Chautauqua (NY), and Ashtabula (OH)

intake_process: Call 717-234-7931 ext. 3078 for SSVF intake or use 24-hour hotline 1-800-654-1211; case management and financial assistance for eligible low-income veteran families
service_area: Dauphin, Lebanon, Cumberland, York, Perry, Adams, Franklin, Juniata, and Mifflin counties in South Central PA

org_name: Community Action Agency of Delaware County, Inc.
intake_process: Call intake line at (610) 384-8387 Monday-Friday 8:30am-4:30pm. Partners with Salvation Army for SSVF program. Phone 2-1-1 if homeless or homelessness is imminent.
service_area: Delaware County, PA. SSVF program serves eligible Veteran families experiencing housing crisis or transitioning to permanent housing.

intake_process: Call, walk-in, or online. Intake is face-to-face. Case manager can meet veterans at their current location. Proof of military service (DD-214) required. Must have eviction notice or be income eligible.
service_area: Butler, Armstrong, and Beaver counties; also serves Lawrence County and surrounding region

intake_process: Call toll-free intake line at 1-866-406-8449 or email ssvfintake@wesoldieron.org. Brief phone intake interview followed by in-person needs assessment.
service_area: 22 Pennsylvania counties including Erie, Warren, McKean, Potter, and 19 others across western PA

org_name: Catholic Charities of the Diocese of Allentown
intake_process: Call to schedule intake appointment with case manager. Veterans must have photo ID and proof of income.
service_area: Lehigh, Northampton, Berks, Schuylkill, and Carbon counties (service locations in Allentown, Reading, and Pottsville)

org_name: Volunteers of America of Pennsylvania, Inc.
intake_process: Phone intake - Call 717-236-1440 or toll-free 855-202-4741. Program specialists evaluate eligibility individually.
service_area: Adams, Cumberland, Dauphin, Lebanon, Lancaster, Perry, and York counties

org_name: Commission on Economic Opportunity of Luzerne County
intake_process: Call (570) 826-0510 or email kdouglas@ceopeoplehelpingpeople.org. Contact Kermit Douglas. Must provide proof of veteran status and income documentation.
service_area: 15 counties in Northeast Pennsylvania including Luzerne, Lackawanna, Monroe, Wyoming, and Susquehanna counties

intake_process: Call 787-891-0059 or email casaperegrinossvf@gmail.com. Serves low-income Veteran Families and those at imminent risk of homelessness with other than dishonorable discharge.
service_area: Puerto Rico-wide (island-wide) veteran services, based in Aguadilla

org_name: Society of St. Vincent de Paul South Pinellas, Inc.
intake_process: Call SSVF line 1-844-877-7783 or contact via ssvfinfo@svdp.care. Organization serves as remote/administrative grantee for Puerto Rico; may coordinate with local partners
service_area: Puerto Rico (specific counties/municipalities not publicly listed)

intake_process: Call 401-383-4730 to initiate intake. Program requires veterans and family members to be at or below 50% of federal poverty guidelines and homeless or imminently at-risk of homelessness.
service_area: Providence County, RI

intake_process: Call (843) 212-8668 or (843) 212-8697 for SSVF Intake Coordinator, or submit online inquiry via website. Intake Coordinator will contact to complete eligibility screening and housing barrier assessment.
service_area: Berkeley County and Charleston County, SC (Lowcountry region)

intake_process: Call SSVF Intake Line at 803-995-8464 or 864-345-1303. Intake completed to determine assistance needed. Veterans and families can walk-in or call to begin application process.
service_area: South Carolina (Midlands/Lowcountry office serves: Calhoun, Fairfield, Kershaw, Lexington, Orangeburg, Richland, Saluda, Sumter counties. Upstate office in Greenville serves additional counties)

intake_process: Intake interview required. Call to schedule. Eligibility: veterans with non-dishonorable discharge and income below 50% of county average.
service_area: South Dakota statewide. Primary service areas: Men's Shelter covers 20+ counties in western SD. SSVF program serves Pennington County and surrounding areas.

org_name: SER Jobs for Progress National, Inc.
intake_process: Contact national office or regional affiliate. National phone: 972-438-5400. South Dakota affiliate information not publicly available.
service_area: Multi-state service area - Grant covers 6 states: South Dakota, Oklahoma, Indiana, North Carolina, Oregon, and California
not_found_reason: South Dakota affiliate/office details not available. Organization is national with multi-state grant. Regional office contact information not localized.

intake_process: Contact SSVF team member by phone or email (ssvf@osdtn.org); bring DD214 or VA ID card; requires proof of income (8 weeks pay stubs or 2 months bank statements)
service_area: Davidson, Sumner, Wilson, Robertson, Trousdale, Cheatham, Rutherford, Williamson, and Dickson counties in Middle Tennessee; secondary office in Clarksville

org_name: Catholic Charities Of The Diocese Of Memphis Inc
intake_process: Call Veteran Intake Line at 901-722-4757 for specialized support. Veterans or those with a veteran in their immediate household currently experiencing homelessness can reach out for assistance.
service_area: 21 counties of West Tennessee; SSVF services primarily in Memphis and Shelby County

intake_process: Call main line or Program Coordinator. SSVF Program Coordinator Sheri Koon: 731-651-1020 or sherik.ths@gmail.com. Referral form submission followed by Intake Coordinator eligibility screening.
service_area: 23 counties in West Tennessee: Benton, Carroll, Chester, Crockett, Decatur, Dyer, Fayette, Gibson, Hardeman, Hardin, Haywood, Henderson, Henry, Houston, Humphreys, Lake, Lauderdale, Madison, McNairy, Obion, Stewart, Tipton, Weakley counties

intake_process: Contact SSVF team member by phone or email (ssvf@osdtn.org); bring DD214 or VA ID card; requires proof of income (8 weeks pay stubs or 2 months bank statements)
service_area: Davidson, Sumner, Wilson, Robertson, Trousdale, Cheatham, Rutherford, Williamson, and Dickson counties in Middle Tennessee; secondary office in Clarksville

intake_process: Contact via phone at 254-634-1184 or 888-799-7233 (24-hour hotline). Intake and eligibility determination conducted over phone. Eligible candidates must be veterans or family members with veteran as head of household/spouse, meet income requirements (up to 50% AMI), and have received discharge other than dishonorable.
service_area: Bell, Coryell, and Hamilton counties in Texas (including Fort Hood military installation)

intake_process: Complete a coordinated assessment at one of five locations or call Caritas of Austin intake hotline at 512-472-4135
service_area: Austin, Texas and surrounding areas (Travis County focus)

intake_process: Contact directly by phone at 214-424-7050 or email through website for referrals to SSVF program
service_area: Dallas, Rockwall, Tarrant, Ellis, Denton, and Collin Counties in North Texas

intake_process: Low-barrier access framework with client-centered service model. Staff conduct intake and assessment, then develop Individualized Housing and Employment Plans (IHEPs) with participants.
service_area: Houston/Harris County area (operates Veterans Village in Willowbrook with 130 beds and Griggs Road service center)

intake_process: Call intake line to determine eligibility and schedule appointment at convenient time/location
service_area: City of Houston, Harris County, Montgomery County

intake_process: Contact via phone or email (communications@caritasofaustin.org). Eligibility: Travis/Williamson/Bastrop County, household income <30% AMI, veteran family member, eligible for VA benefits
service_area: Travis, Williamson, and Bastrop County

intake_process: Call 325-672-8544 during business hours (Monday-Friday 8:30 AM - 5:00 PM). Services include outreach, case management, public services coordination, limited temporary financial assistance
service_area: 25 counties in West Central Texas including Brown, Callahan, Coleman, Comanche, Eastland, Fisher, Haskell, Jones, Kent, Knox, Mitchell, Nolan, Runnels, Scurry, Shackelford, Stephens, Stonewall, Taylor, Throckmorton, and additional counties

intake_process: Call 833-828-6439 for emergency financial assistance and one-on-one case management including rental/utility payments and VA benefits access
service_area: San Antonio area and 131 counties across 12 Texas locations

org_name: American GI Forum National Veterans Outreach Program, Inc.
intake_process: Contact main office or regional representatives. SSVF intake conducted by program staff. Must provide DD214, proof of income, and information on current housing situation.
service_area: South Texas and multiple regions served by American GI Forum

intake_process: New Client Registration via website or phone call. Case managers assess circumstances, develop housing stability plans, determine eligibility for financial support, and connect ineligible applicants with alternative resources.
service_area: North Texas, West Texas, Panhandle - 20 North Texas counties including Dallas, Fort Worth, Denton, Tarrant, and surrounding counties

intake_process: Outreach & engagement in shelters, libraries, VA facilities, and streets. Veterans complete application and documentation review. Eligible applicants placed on waitlist or matched to available housing. Case management focused on increasing income, accessing benefits, and achieving long-term stability.
service_area: Salt Lake County, Utah

intake_process: Veterans at imminent risk of becoming homeless within the next 30 days contact the Intake Coordinator at 804-788-6825 ext. 260. Complete screening questionnaire. Staff provides case management, housing services, outreach, and temporary financial assistance for rent, utilities, security deposits, and other housing-related costs.
service_area: Charlottesville, Richmond, and South Hampton Roads regions of Virginia

org_name: Total Action Against Poverty In Roanoke Valley
intake_process: Contact by phone or email. Eligibility screening for veteran and family status, income qualification, and housing need. Application includes screening questionnaire. Case management assists families in establishing plans to obtain and retain self-sufficiency through housing assistance.
service_area: Roanoke Valley and Alleghany counties, Virginia

intake_process: Complete preliminary application online or by phone. Submit documentation (ID, income verification forms). Eligible applicants placed on waitlist or matched to available housing. Services include rental assistance, security deposits, moving costs, utility assistance, childcare, transportation, and emergency supplies.
service_area: Virginia Beach, Portsmouth, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Suffolk, Franklin, Isle of Wight, and Southampton, Virginia

intake_process: Phone screening followed by in-person intake appointment. Requires Photo ID for all adults and DD Form 214 for veteran discharge verification.
service_area: Multiple Virginia Continuums of Care including Harrisonburg, Winchester, Fredericksburg, Arlington County, Fairfax County, Loudoun County, Alexandria, and Prince William County

intake_process: Rapid Rehousing and Homelessness Prevention Program intake. Contact via phone for detailed screening process.
service_area: Virginia

intake_process: Phone screening with income verification. In-person intake appointment required. Must provide Photo ID for all adults and DD Form 214 showing discharge status (cannot serve dishonorable discharges).
service_area: Peninsula of Virginia (Greater Hampton Roads area)

org_name: Meeting the Needs of Our Community, INC.
intake_process: Phone intake screening at (340) 714-7782 or (340) 713-0555. Services focus on homeless prevention, rapid re-housing, and Housing First models for veterans.
service_area: U.S. Virgin Islands

org_name: YWCA of Seattle - King County - Snohomish County
intake_process: Phone screening at (425) 264-1426 or email. After phone screening, participants scheduled for in-person intake appointment at shelter.
service_area: King County and Snohomish County, Washington

intake_process: Community-based outreach; veterans contact main line or housing crisis lines for rapid re-housing case management
service_area: King County

intake_process: Community Resource Center walk-in appointments M-F 9 AM-4 PM; online veterans services portal
service_area: Whatcom, Skagit, Island, San Juan, Clallam, Jefferson Counties

org_name: Catholic Community Services of Western Washington
intake_process: Contact regional offices by phone or email; specialized SSVF intake available through housing services
service_area: King, Whatcom, Skagit, Snohomish, Pierce Counties in Western Washington

intake_process: Call main SSVF line or visit ssvf.us; office open M-F 8 AM-4 PM; phone intake available
service_area: Grant, Okanogan, Douglas, Chelan, Adams, Kittitas Counties

org_name: Community Action Coalition for South Central Wisconsin, Inc.
intake_process: Contact main office or visit website for SSVF program enrollment; alternative office at 2717 N Grandview Blvd, Waukesha
service_area: Dane, Jefferson, Waukesha Counties

intake_process: Contact by phone at 715-532-4222. Veterans must meet eligibility requirements: honorable or other than dishonorable discharge, low income (not more than 50% AMI), and homeless or at imminent risk of homelessness. Program provides emergency housing, financial assistance, case management, and referrals to other services.
service_area: 19 counties in northern Wisconsin including Ashland, Bayfield, Burnett, Douglas, Menominee, Oneida, Polk, Rusk, Sawyer, and surrounding counties

intake_process: Phone intake at 414-345-3917. Veterans must be under 80% Area Median Income and homeless or at-risk of becoming homeless. SSVF provides assistance paying for housing, finding housing, case management, connection to veteran benefits, and financial education.
service_area: 28 counties across Wisconsin including Brown, Calumet, Columbia, Dodge, Door, Fond du Lac, Grant, Green, Milwaukee, Outagamie, Ozaukee, Racine, Waukesha, Winnebago, and others

org_name: The Greater Wheeling Coalition for the Homeless, Inc.
intake_process: Phone intake Monday-Friday 9am-5pm at 304-232-6105. Walk-in appointments daily 2pm-4pm. SSVF provides case management, help finding housing, temporary rental assistance, assistance with VA benefits, and bus passes. Serves homeless veterans and families at imminent risk of homelessness.
service_area: Brooke, Hancock, Ohio, Marshall, and Wetzel counties in West Virginia

intake_process: Phone intake Monday-Friday 9am-4pm at 304-232-0114. CARF-accredited rapid rehousing and homelessness prevention program. Services include emergency shelter, transitional housing, rental assistance, financial assistance, case management, and food pantry services for homeless and housing-insecure veterans.
service_area: Hancock, Brooke, Ohio, Marshall, and Wetzel counties in West Virginia

org_name: West Virginia Community Action Partnerships Inc
intake_process: Contact Southwestern Community Action Council (regional administrator) at 304-525-5151 for SSVF intake in Huntington area. SSVF provides outreach, case management, assistance obtaining VA benefits, health care services, personal financial planning, transportation services, housing counseling, and case management for very low-income veteran families transitioning to or in permanent housing.
service_area: Statewide West Virginia coverage through multiple regional Community Action Partnerships including service in Cabell County (Huntington area) and surrounding regions
